content.description: Starts on an easy slab to the first bolt. Work your way right along a seam, and then cut back left to the hueco. Shake out and then climb a burly boulder trending right and pulling up onto the slab. Shake out and then work your way up and left through some tricky climbing to the anchor.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the Digimon sector at the base of a slab. Look for an obvious hole/hueco near the third bolt. Ascends a steep overhanging face, and then wanders up and left to the chains.

content.description: Techy climbing on great pink limestone.
content.location: First route to the right of the Scrum Felcher (10c) corner. Starts on a slab up to a short tufa, then pulls onto the vertical pink face with crimps and techy movement. Turns slabby at the top where you can clip the chains, or continue up the 13- extension, MACMFR (Meat and Cheese Memorial Face Route) for 5 more bolts.

content.description: A couple bolts going up some slab which works its way into a corner. Use the tufa to get your self a little higher. Then finish off on some stepper slab / crimping.

climbs.name: MACMFR (Meat and Cheese Memorial Face Route)

content.description: 13- extension to Waste Not Want Not (12b).
content.location: Continue past the chains of Waste Not Want Not onto the blue overhung head wall for another 5 bolts.

content.description: Initial sharpness leads to better holds at an enjoyable angle.  High anchors to keep the rope from rubbing over edges.Might still need some cleaning.
content.location: (Currently) most left route on the entire wall.  To the left of the mini-cave.  Could probably have a second pitch added for the motivated.

content.description: 2-bolt extension to East West Connection (12a).  Clip the first set of chains and then boulder your way through the steep headwall.
content.location: Climb past the first set of chains of East West Connection through two more bolts + chains.

content.description: Techy face climbing with a tricky finish.
content.location: Next route right of Designer Dog (13a). Starts with a tricky bulge to a slab (stick clip recommended). Trends slightly rightward through a vertical face to a set of anchors below a steep headwall. Stop here (12a) or continue through two more bolts to the second set of chains (13a).

content.description: The namesake of the area this route is short but very good if you like the style! Positive but very small crimps and edges on good vertical black rock.
content.location: Furthest right rout in the digimon sector

content.description:
Great route with lots of varied movement and features. A tricky slab gets your attention off the ground (stick clip recommended). Enjoy the tufa and face climbing before a boulder problem traverse, and another boulder guarding the chains.

 A hold near the top of the route can be wet, but it can be avoided if you have the right beta.
content.location: Starts to the right of Waste Not Want Not on the same tricky slab. Climbs past three bolts to a small cave feature. Continue up above the small cave, using the tufa out right before working left across the face to a short overhung dihedral section. From here, traverse right through the overhanging face past 3 bolts to the anchor. Long draw recommended before the traverse.

content.description: Furthest left area that host mostly 5.12 and higher routes.
